title: Pink Wards, Potions, etc...
body:
Hey All,

I saw a post about people noticing that pink wards are not on all recommended pages and some people mentioned that there were also potions and even trinkets(looking at you singed) missing on a few. I am going to look at fixing all that I can tonight so that we can get it complete for you guys(especially to help newer players). 

If any of you have any other things that seem to be missing please let me know and I'll try to get them all fixed ASAP. 

Thanks

Edit: Just wanted to set the expectation here. I will be working on this tonight but due to the timing of it, it will not be on live till patch 6.4. Thanks everyone for the super helpful responses.

Can you take the opportunity to replace the "potion x3" with "refillable potion" on a lot of jungler's page?

Main offender imho is Sion, but there are probably others.

Also, could you explain why Relic Shield is recommended for Thresh instead of Ancient Coin? Or Spell Thief on Janna (maybe not anymore) last time I checked was a few months ago)? How do you decide in such cases where many starters are viable?

So this one is tough because when the jungle changes came out with preseason a lot of people had issues with surviving with refillable. I want to make sure that even the newest players are able to clear the jungle in a healthy fashion, and once people get more comfortable they are able to make the decision on what works better for them. 

Relic is pretty standard for Thresh from my knowledge. Janna it is definitely a toss up, I can see it either way.

Acutally, I'd keep thresh with coin for beginners. I see too many threads in 'Report a bug' claiming that thresh isn't proccing Relics, which shows that they don't have enough knowledge about the game.

Why tank supports like {{champion:89}} have {{item:3068}} as recommended items for them? Sunfire Cape tends to be a bad item for supports because it disrupts your ally's waveclear, doesn't have utility (Randuins has a slow, FH has an attack speed reduction aura, Deadman's Plate has a movement speed steroid with a slow on-attack that helps in initiating) and supports can't afford to have magic penetration on their runes and masteries, nor they can afford to build flat magic penetration items like Sorcerer's Shoes or Haunting Guise. This makes Sunfire Cape do very little damage. Is there any reason why Riot recommends Sunfire Cape as an item for Leona? (I don't know if it is also recommended for Thresh or Braum or Tahm Kench, but for Leona it is).

But. But. But. The Sun. That is Leona's thing. Not recommending SUNfire cape on Leona, the sun champion, is considered heresy by the Iron Solari (or whatever her faction is) and is punishable by death, or worse, 10 games with trolls and toxic players fighting against a team of Diamond Smurfs. [/s]

Hey, I'm here with couple of things concerning {{champion:143}}.

First of all, she doesn't have Recommended Mid items at all. I think that it shouldn't be too hard to implement to new champion select (where it is known where the player is going) for client to choose mid or support items. I can reply my commonly used items on mid if anyone wants to hear.

Second, I think that she could have a jungle recommendations too. Because, why not confuse newer players even more if they happen to bring the harmless plant to its home, jungle. :P So, uh, she is pretty easy to jungle after getting second camp down, because the plants can take 6 attacks from monsters before dying. Her ganks are good too: even if the root misses, it will still deal a nice chunk of damage to enemies <3

Third thing, the support recommended items doesn't have {{item:3151}} in there at all! I think it should swap place with {{item:3165}} if you want to keep 3 items per category. {{item:3110}} is second item which I think that I've never bought on Zyra... She's played more as "an AP mid on botlane" than "a real support" (at least in my hands), so I think that having {{item:3157}} in place of Frozen Heart would make more sense. I think this is more personal thing, but I value {{item:3060}} over {{item:3190}} because it gives AP and splitpush threat.

I'll gladly answer if you have any questions concerning Zyra. I will answer as well as I can from my experience, 85k xp/gold2 at end of season (sorry if I sound arrogant, I couldn't word up that better). I just _reaaally_ want players to have best possible experience with her. _(Can't wait to see her get a new passive on mid-year mage update...)_
-Karppa
